channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Many potholes along Tewkesbury road near the railway bridge, 31st January
item.description:
Many potholes along Tewkesbury road near the railway bridge. This is a very busy road so it's challenging to avoid the pot holes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 456, High Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many potholes along Argyll Road where there's parked cars, 31st January
item.description:
Many potholes along Argyll Road. Parked cars are on one side of the road, therefore only one side of the road can be driven on. This makes it difficult to navigate around the pot holes in a vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Argyll Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing turning off. When the pedestrian crossing button it pressed it doesn't always activate a crossing and the light goes off. This happens very often leading to pedestrians crossing on a red light due to the issue., 31st January
item.description:
All crossings at grey hound lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 massive potholes on Bethesda Street, 31st January
item.description:
Two potholes on Bethesda Street towards the Commercial Street end, they are absolutely huge, way over tennis ball depth and dinner plate width, they are really dangerous as cars park on the other side of the road and it's becoming impossible to get through. They are getting worse and worse daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bethesda Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pothole in Kidnappers Lane, 31st January
item.description:
As marked on map. This pothole lies just beyond Cheringtons, heading towards the High School. It is a long and deep pothole that would damage a tyre, wheel and suspension. We've had to swerve round it as have others. As the road is narrow that puts you at risk of an accident. There are multiple other potholes in Kidnappers - how about a crew does an inspection and fixes the lot?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lorry's parking on pavement, destroying the pavement and putting additional stress on the coal vaults under the pavement., 31st January
item.description:
There were a number of bollards on the pavement at the end of Albert Place where it joins Prestbury Road. Last week more bollards where erected further down the street, which although it stops vehicles parking on this stretch of the road, just pushes the problem further down the street. The very next day, we can home to a lorry parked outside our house, but delivering goods to houses further up the street where the new bollards have been erected, see attached photo. The consequence of these additional bollards will increase the amount of vehicles parked on the pavement further down the street, which will put increased pressure on the pavement, which is already in a poor state of repair, and also the vaults that run under the pavement. Can we request that erection of additional bollards to run the course of Albert Place, up to the junction with Selkirk Street, which would then eliminate the issue on both the pavements and coal vaults.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Albert Place, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
